page.title: 03Landscape in the Horton Area
page.content: The landscape in Horton and Little Sodbury is dominated by the Cotswold scarp slope and the Vale of Sodbury. There is grassland and crops with the occasional woods or trees on the hills The villages of Horton and Little Sodbury lie at the foot of the escarpment of the Cotswold hills where the jurassic limestone meets the clay vale.The villages were probably sited here in the first place because water was available from springs.The grass is used for grazing for dairy farming and hay is also grown which is harvested in summer and used as a winter feed.There are not many houses in the village of Horton and most of these are old.The surrounding landscape is made up of individual dairy farms on the clay of the Vale of Sodbury.
